snippet: A brazen brand of crony capitalism has created huge fortunes for a few, at the expense of the nation as a whole, which is falling short in energy infrastructure.
abstract: Coal mining scandal in India is exposing the ugly underside of Indian politics and economic life; brazen style of crony capitalism has enabled politicians and their friends to reap huge profits by gaining control of vast swaths of the country’s natural resources, at the expense of the nation as a whole, which is falling short in energy infrastructure.

byline.original: By VIKAS BAJAJ and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: Sruthi Gottipati and Hari Kumar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A brazen brand of crony capitalism has created huge fortunes for a few, at the expense of the nation as a whole, which is falling short in energy infrastructure.

headline.seo: Scandal Bares Corruption Hampering India’s Growth
headline.main: Scandal Poses a Riddle: Will India Ever Be Able to Tackle Corruption?
headline.print_headline: Scandal Poses a Query: Will India Ever Be Able To Tackle Corruption?
